title: The day John Humphrys tried to doorstep Her Majesty the Queen
text:
Among the many thousands of interviews that John Humphrys has conducted in his 60-year journalistic career, there is one that stands out. At least, to John himself.

This is someone who has presented more than 5,000 editions of Radio 4’s Today programme. He has interviewed every British prime minister since Alec Douglas-Home [to Theresa May]. He has quizzed leaders and public figures from US presidents to Nelson Mandela. He even attempted to doorstep Her Majesty the Queen during a visit to the BBC’s New Broadcasting House – an effort for which, I recall, he was royally put in his place.

Yet the encounter that most sticks in his mind was on the streets of Soweto in 1994, as South Africa was preparing...
